meanings.definition: The action of selling off assets or business interests.
meanings.sent1: The divestiture of the company's shares led to a decrease in ownership.
meanings.sent2: After the divestiture of her jewelry collection, she felt relieved to have less clutter.
meanings.sent3: The divestiture of his toy cars to his little brother made him feel like a generous sibling.
meanings.sent4: Her divestiture of old habits paved the way for new opportunities in her life.
meanings.sent5: The divestiture of the old building breathed new life into the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The act of stripping someone of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The divestiture of the dictator's control brought freedom to the people.
meanings.sent2: The divestiture of the manager's decision-making authority caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent3: The divestiture of the teacher's ruler made the students cheer silently.
meanings.sent4: His divestiture of the crown symbolized the end of his reign.
meanings.sent5: The divestiture of the bully's power restored peace to the school.
